title: 7 LinkedIn Hooks That Actually Work for SaaS Founders
excerpt: Use these tested openings to stop the scroll and start conversations with buyers and investors.
content:
Strong hooks buy you the next 2 seconds. Here are seven that repeatedly perform for my SaaS clients:

  1. “We wasted £12,400 on the wrong ICP. Here’s how we fixed it.”
  2. “The onboarding bug cost us 23% in activations. Postmortem 👇”
  3. “If your demo-to-close is under 15%, try this.”
  4. “3 emails that booked 18 demos last month.”
  5. “Don’t hire a content agency until you read this.”
  6. “What I’d do if I had to get 10 customers in 30 days.”
  7. “We built the wrong feature for 6 months. Lessons.”

Pair each hook with a concrete story, a number, and a CTA. Save this and test one this week.

title: Turn Your LinkedIn Profile Into a Lead Funnel
excerpt: A simple 30-minute makeover that converts views into conversations.
content:
Quick wins:

  • Headline: outcome + audience (e.g., “We get SaaS to 20% MoM with product-led onboarding”).
  • About: 3-paragraph story → problem, method, proof.
  • Featured: pin 2–3 posts with lead magnets or case studies.
  • CTA: calendar link in the first line of About.

Do this and you’ll notice higher quality connection requests and more DMs.

title: A Simple Content Calendar for Busy Solo Founders
excerpt: Consistency beats perfection. Here’s a 3–post/week system that compounds.
content:
Use this rotation:

  • Mon — Story: a real, raw moment from the build.
  • Wed — Teach: a tactical tip with screenshots.
  • Fri — Proof: milestone, customer quote, or mini-case study.

Batch write on Sunday. Schedule on Monday. Review on Friday. Simple.
